title: weird warning diagnostic when nesting panics: unreachale nested panic is not unreachable

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
fn main() {
    unreachable!("oh no: {}", panic!("unreachable!!"));
}
```

The current output is:

```
warning: unreachable expression
 --> src/main.rs:2:31
  |
2 |     unreachable!("oh no: {}", panic!("unreachable!!"));
  |                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |                               |
  |                               unreachable expression
  |                               any code following this expression is unreachable
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default
```

It looks like rustc is telling me that the `panic!("unreachable")` is unreachable, but when running the code, it is actually executed:
````
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.89s
     Running `target/debug/ff`
thread 'main' panicked at 'unreachable!!', src/main.rs:2:31
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrac
````
